Like building the whole thing using the built-in Endurance ship

(Making the Ranger and Lander as subassemblies)

Save the subassembly from the docking port that it's going to attach with

You can't launch the fully constructed endurance from the ground, it'll lag like crazy, I use hyperedit for that

Save the subassembly from the docking port that it's going to attach with

You can't launch the fully constructed endurance from the ground, it'll lag like crazy, I use hyperedit for that

I tried but the Ranger won't stick on..

I can use MechJeb to dock the Landers
If anyone needs, I have the Endurance with the 2 rangers and 2 landers on it in the VAB.

I'm having trouble building the Endurance as a whole part (Endurance, 2 Rangers, 2 Landers)

This might be able to help... Endurance 2.0

I don't think an ore mining module is needed. The current modules don't rely on fuel to produce power.

Oh, I don't know. It would be nice for a new colony to be able to resupply a ranger stationed there.

The ranger doesn't work in FAR because FAR is realistic. The ranger has no control surfaces whatsoever. There's no way it could ever fly.

Yes, there is a way: "The spacecraft uses a novel aerodynamic control system that relies on chemical thrusters and electrically powered air jets to provide pitch, yaw, and roll control. This effectively eliminates a slew of moving aircraft parts such as flaps, ailerons, elevators, and rudders, which would otherwise increase drag, weight, and mechanical complexity."

http://interstellarfilm.wikia.com/wiki/Ranger

This might be able to help... Endurance 2.0

It works thanks!

KAS has been updated to 1.0.2.......................

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92514-1-0-2-Kerbal-Attachment-System-%28KAS%29-0-5-1

Has been for awhile besides, Endurance relies purely on KIS

Sorry if this is a silly question (couldn't find an answer) but is there a way to minimize the amount of options available in the right-click menu on the Ranger in flight? Sometimes the menu extends too far, and I can't move the camera around to see all the options.

On a similar note, is there a way to add a controlNode in the Unity file so that the "Control from Here" option aligns with the docking port to making docking easier?

Sorry if this is a silly question (couldn't find an answer) but is there a way to minimize the amount of options available in the right-click menu on the Ranger in flight? Sometimes the menu extends too far, and I can't move the camera around to see all the options.

On a similar note, is there a way to add a controlNode in the Unity file so that the "Control from Here" option aligns with the docking port to making docking easier?

I don't think this is a silly question at all. In fact, I had both of these issues. What I did was edit the ranger.cfg to remove the docking port (but not the node it sits on) and attached a regular docking port part to that node. It solved both problems--reduced the menu to a managable size and let me control from the now separate docking port.

I may end up cloning the docking port from the Ranger model to create a standalone docking port. Kind of unnecessary work but I really like the way Benjee10's / the Rangers port looks.

Unless he wants to make a version that doesn't have the port on the back and make the docking port a separate piece... -nudge nudge-

I may end up cloning the docking port from the Ranger model to create a standalone docking port. Kind of unnecessary work but I really like the way Benjee10's / the Rangers port looks.

Unless he wants to make a version that doesn't have the port on the back and make the docking port a separate piece... -nudge nudge-

That's the plan yes. There would have been separate versions anyway, I was just hoping to keep it integrated if possible since that allows you to use the docking port to EVA kerbals out.

Ahhh, I gotchya. It's not impossible to dock, but would make it so much easier. Unfortunately no Cooper kerbals will be standing heroically out the back airlock...

I'm glad that's the plan though, good to know!

benjee do u plan on adding remote tech, cryofreeze and tac support? Current built in tac support only lasts for a short amount of time, I can probably add some if u want

btw, the endurance's bottom nodes are flipped

EDIT: Tac works well now, freezing somewhat works still a bit buggy

Edited May 24, 2015 by xxhansonmaxx

Really like this mod, I've used the endurance ring in so many ways that I am sure weren't intended, great work guys, because of your work I have bases on 3 planets, and planning to do 2 more today, will post pictures soon

Heres cfg's for TAC and DeepFreeze

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92806-WIP-25-PaladinLabs-Dev-Thread-DeepFreeze-cryonic-crew-storage-v-14/page20

That's the plan yes. There would have been separate versions anyway, I was just hoping to keep it integrated if possible since that allows you to use the docking port to EVA kerbals out.

a second for separate flat docking port - could be used on the Lander as well to eliminate those ugly stock ports (hint - separate mod with 3 sizes of your flat docking ports, i would split them myself but my blender skills are rusted for the moment)
